Analgesics or other suitable methods should be used to ensure, as far as possible, that pain, suffering, distress or injury is minimised. Its application, when appropriate, should be carried out or supervised by a veterinarian (art, 26.2 Royal Decree 53/13).

Whenever compatible with the purposes of the procedure/intervention, when an animal is expected to suffer pain after having recovered from anaesthesia, preventive and palliative analgesic treatment, or another appropriate method to relieve pain, will be applied (art, 26.5 Royal Decree 53/13).
Will analgesia be used at any point in the experimental process?
Note: please remember that exceptions require providing the respective document in section '5.4 Special situations'.
